Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, interior covered with traces of a brown resinous substance, with remains of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, faded in places, containing text of religious nature.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.73-74)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372002) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372002)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 54 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
